description: Four paintings, including two by artist Bryan Pearce valued at a combined £100,000, are stolen from an isolated cottage in west Cornwall.
title: Bryan Pearce paintings worth £100k stolen in burglary
title_page: Bryan Pearce paintings worth £100k stolen in burglary - BBC News
maintext:
Four paintings, including a pair by one artist valued at a combined £100,000, have been stolen in what may have been a targeted burglary in Cornwall.
The paintings, by artist Bryan Pearce, were taken from an isolated cottage in Zennor between Friday 16 and Tuesday 27 January, Devon and Cornwall Police said.
The pictures, Portreath and Jug & Catkins, both date from 1960.
Thieves entered by forcing a ground floor window, police said.
